ArticleTitle.sentence: Induction of cytokine expression in leukocytes by binding of thrombin-stimulated platelets.

AbstractText.sentence: BACKGROUND: Activated platelets tether and activate myeloid leukocytes.

event.clue: BACKGROUND: Activated platelets tether and activate myeloid leukocytes.
BACKGROUND: Activated platelets tether and activate myeloid leukocytes.
BACKGROUND: Activated platelets tether and activate myeloid leukocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: To investigate the potential relevance of this mechanism in acute myocardial infarction (AMI), we examined cytokine induction by leukocyte-platelet adhesion and the occurrence of leukocyte-platelet conjugates in patients with AMI.

event.clue: To investigate the potential relevance of this mechanism in acute myocardial infarction (AMI), we examined cytokine induction by leukocyte-platelet adhesion and the occurrence of leukocyte-platelet conjugates in patients with AMI.

AbstractText.sentence: METHODS AND RESULTS: We obtained peripheral venous blood samples in 20 patients with AMI before and daily for 5 days after direct percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA) and in 20 patients undergoing elective PTCA.

Throughout the study period, CD41 immunofluorescence of leukocytes (flow cytometry) revealed increased leukocyte-platelet adhesion in patients with AMI compared with control patients (mean +/- SE of fluorescence [channels] before PTCA: 77 +/- 16 versus 35 +/- 9; P = .003).

event.clue: Throughout the study period, CD41 immunofluorescence of leukocytes (flow cytometry) revealed increased leukocyte-platelet adhesion in patients with AMI compared with control patients (mean +/- SE of fluorescence [channels] before PTCA: 77 +/- 16 versus 35 +/- 9; P = .003).
